bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, October 6, 1941

div1.p: Truby mentions the uniforms worn in Cuba and also asks to view a map of Cuba in 1899 to refresh his memory.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, October 6, 1941
div1.opener:
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
Oct 6, 41
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have your letter of the 1st with
inclosures; also the Copy of Hygeia. Thanks,
Have made a few notes on the
inclosures and am returning them herewith
I am so far away that information from
me is ancient history before it gets
back to you. That is probably why
Mr. Kellogg made no effort to get my
views on helmets etc. at any rate
the painting is correct enough, as to
uniforms to meet the most critical
views. The War Dept. had prescribed no specific
tropical uniforms when we went to
Cuba in 1898 and it took a long time
to establish uniformity.

Hope your cold is better. I am
on my feet again and feeling
pretty well. Mrs. Truby returns on
Wednesday, after 3 mon. in the East
and I will be most happy to have
hera back home again.

I will be glad to get your notes on
my mms. Kean is sending the other
copy back with his remarks and seems
AC
T
to be in a hurry to have me finish
it for the S.G.O. to publish. I dont
fancy doing things in a hurry as
without a stenographer I am very
slow and like to take plenty of time.

I have not heard from Carlisle
since Col. Willits left so I am going
to prod them up about a photo of
the model on prepared terrain. Of
course they are very busy with their
war work.

I did not know that Miss Reed
was proposing an article on her
father's work. Did she have much
interesting material that is new?
Must close now.

closer.seg:
✓P.S.
I would like very much to see the
map you found in Cuba (1899) my mind
is still hazy about a few buildings on
the north eastern boundary of our hospital grounds
and a 1899 map would clear that up at
once. I hope you will approve of my using
the maps in my article and I would also
like to use the small photo of the 2d Division
Hospital. All the rest of the illustrations are
my own - AET
